title: Task 36

question.text: What does Sophie mean by saying I've been stuck on it for a while?

answers.answer: She recently started working on the issue
answers.feedback: The phrase I've been stuck suggests an ongoing issue, not something recent.

answers.answer: She has had difficulty with the issue for some time

answers.feedback: Being stuck implies ongoing difficulty, not successful completion.

answers.answer: She is waiting for someone else to start it
answers.feedback: Stuck refers to her own ongoing struggle with the issue, not waiting on others.

dialogue.text: I've been stuck on it for a while.

description: Stuck means unable to move or progress. In this context, Sophie uses stuck to express difficulty in progressing with her coding issue. The present perfect tense I've been stuck indicates an ongoing situation that started in the past and continues to the present, emphasizing the duration of her challenge.
